force:source:convert.description: convert source into Metadata API format

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

rootdir.name: rootdir
rootdir.description: a source directory other than the default package to convert

outputdir.name: outputdir
outputdir.description: output directory to store the Metadata API–formatted files in

packagename.name: packagename
packagename.description: name of the package to associate with the metadata-formatted files

manifest.name: manifest
manifest.description: file path to manifest (package.xml) of metadata types to convert.

sourcepath.name: sourcepath
sourcepath.description: comma-separated list of paths to the local source files to convert

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.description: comma-separated list of metadata component names to convert

examples: $ sfdx force:source:deploy -m "ApexClass, Profile:My Profile, Profile: AnotherProfile"

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

checkonly.name: checkonly
checkonly.description: validate deploy but don’t save to the org

soapdeploy.name: soapdeploy
soapdeploy.description: deploy metadata with SOAP API instead of REST API

wait.name: wait
wait.description: wait time for command to finish in minutes

ignoreerrors.name: ignoreerrors
ignoreerrors.description: ignore any errors and do not roll back deployment

ignorewarnings.name: ignorewarnings
ignorewarnings.description: whether a warning will allow a deployment to complete successfully

validateddeployrequestid.name: validateddeployrequestid
validateddeployrequestid.description: deploy request ID of the validated deployment to run a Quick Deploy

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.description: comma-separated list of metadata component names

sourcepath.name: sourcepath
sourcepath.description: comma-separated list of source file paths to deploy

manifest.name: manifest
manifest.description: file path for manifest (package.xml) of components to deploy

force:source:open.description:
edit a Lightning Page with Lightning App Builder
Opens the specified Lightning Page in Lightning App Builder. Lightning Page files have the suffix .flexipage-meta.xml, and are stored in the flexipages directory. If you specify a different type of file, this command opens your org’s home page.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

urlonly.name: urlonly
urlonly.description: generate a navigation URL; don’t launch the editor

examples: sfdx force:source:retrieve -n "Package1, PackageName With Spaces, Package3"

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

sourcepath.name: sourcepath
sourcepath.description: comma-separated list of source file paths to retrieve

wait.name: wait
wait.description: wait time for command to finish in minutes

manifest.name: manifest
manifest.description: file path for manifest (package.xml) of components to retrieve

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.description: comma-separated list of metadata component names

packagenames.name: packagenames
packagenames.description: a comma-separated list of packages to retrieve

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

wait.name: wait
wait.description: wait time for command to finish in minutes

jobid.name: jobid
jobid.description: job ID of the deployment you want to cancel; defaults to your most recent CLI deployment if not specified

force:source:deploy:report.description: check the status of a metadata deployment
examples: Deploy a directory of files to the org
Now cancel this deployment and wait two minutes
If you have multiple deployments in progress and want to cancel a specific one, specify the job ID
Check the status of the cancel job
